info.author: Felix Meyer-Wolters
info.description: ## Usage ``` ╔═════════════╗ ║ Omplate ║ ╚═════════════╝ A template system for dev projects (multilingual). Make templates for automated project creation with ease. Handle your templates with Omplates beautiful Posix style cli. Info: Use -i flag if you want to run omplate in Interactive Mode. See 'Options' for more info. Usage: omplate create project (--env=) (--cfg=) (--args-yaml= | -i) omplate show settings omplate show templates [--env=] [--tmpl=] [-i] omplate add template (--cfg=) [-i] omplate remove template (--env=) (--tmpl=) [-i] omplate test template [--env=] [--tmpl=] [-i] omplate -h | --help omplate --version Commands: create project Create a new project from a template. show Show app settings or a list of templates with their configs. add template Add a template (more precisely: its cfg file) to the main register of templates. remove template Remove a template (more precisely: its cfg file) from the main register of templates. test template Run test for one or multiple templates. Works only if template provides a test file. Options: --cfg= The path to the config.yaml of the template. --env= Template are categorized in environments. E.g. 'cpython', 'nodejs', ... --tmpl= The template name, with which you can find the template in its environment. -i --interactive Run omplate in 'Interactive Mode'. With this option set, Omplate asks the user to type-in missing (required) values before executing a command. --args-yaml= The 'create project' command requires a lot of options which may vary depending on the template engine that is run. In this case you can either pass the options via a yaml file or use -i flag to get the values interactively from the user. -h --help Show this screen. --version Show version. ``` ## Documentation http://omplate.readthedocs.io/en/latest/
info.name: omplate
